text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron indicum is an Azalea Rhododendron species native to Japan (S & W Honshu, Shikoku, Kyushu, Yakushima). It is the type species for the Tsutsusi section and subsection, and was the original Tsutsusi described by Engelbert Kaempfer in Japan in 1712, from the Japanese name Kirishima-tsutsuji.
text.Cultivation: There are many cultivars, including the Satsuki azaleas.
text.Bibliography:
The Linnaean Plant Name Typification Project: Azalea indica L.
